description: An ecotope map of the Sea Scheldt for 2013 was created based on two fundamental information layers: a physiotope map and a geomorphological map. Ecotope maps are used to follow up the evolution of the diversity of habitats.
keywords: ecotopenkaart, Zeeschelde, ecotopen, schorren, slikken, ecotope map, Sea Scheldt, ecotopes, salt marshes, mud flats, Habitats and biotopes
name: Ecotope map (Sea Scheldt, Rupel & Durme, 2013)
